smmcalibrationÂ¶

Standard usage of tweezepy involves instantiating one of the main user-facing classes, AV and PSD.

class tweezepy.smmcalibration.AV(trace, fsample, taus='octave', mode='oavar', edf='real')Â¶

A class for computing and fitting the Allan variance using maximum likelihood estimation.

Parameters

  • trace (array) â Bead trajectory in nm.

  • fsample (float) â Sampling frequency in Hz.

  • taus (str, optional) â Tau interval sampling. Options are âoctaveâ, âdecadeâ, and âallâ, by default âoctaveâ

  • mode (str, optional) â Allan variance type, either âavarâ, âoavarâ, and âtotvarâ, by default âoavarâ

  • edf (str, optional) â Equivalent degrees of freedom for AV. Options are ârealâ and âapproxâ, by default ârealâ

Raises

AssertionError â If taus, mode, or edf is not recognized.

Examples

>>> from tweezepy import downsampled_trace
>>> trace = downsampled_trace() # Simulate sample data in nm
>>> av = AV(trace,fsample = 100) # Compute overlapping AV
>>> av.mlefit() # Perform MLE fit
>>> print(av.results)
mlefit(fitfunc='SMMAV', cutoffs=[- inf, inf], tracking_error=False, guess=None, gamma=None, kappa=None, epsilon=None, kT=4.1, viscosity=8.94e-10, radius=530.0, pedantic=True, scale_covar=False, **kwargs)Â¶

Estimate parameters and uncertainties via maximum likelihood estimation.

Parameters

  • fitfunc (str or function, optional) â String or user defined function, by default âSMMAVâ

  • tracking_error (bool, optional) â Incorporate tracking errors, by default False

  • guess (list, optional) â Initial parameter guesses, by default None

  • gamma (float, optional) â Fixed value for gamma parameter, by default None

  • kappa (float, optional) â Fixed value for kappa parameter, by default None

  • epsilon (float, optional) â Fixed value for epsilon parameter, by default None

  • kT (float, optional) â Thermal energy used in functions and initial parameter guesses, by default 4.1

  • viscosity (float, optional) â Dynamic viscosity for initial parameter guesses in pN s/nm^2, by default 8.94e-10

  • radius (float, optional) â Bead radius for inital parameter guesses, by default 530.

  • pedantic (bool, optional) â Ignore unhelpful warning messages, by default True

  • scale_covar (bool, optional) â Whether to scale covariance by reduced chi-squared, by default False

  • **kwargs â keyword arguments passed to scipyâs minimizer

plot(fig=None, fig_kwgs={}, ax_fit_kwgs={}, ax_res_kwgs={}, data_label=None, fit_label=None, **kwargs)Â¶

Utility function for plotting

Parameters

  • fig (Figure, optional) â Matplotlib Figure object, by default None

  • fig_kwgs (dict, optional) â Figure keyword arguments, by default {}

  • ax_fit_kwgs (dict, optional) â Axis keyword arguments, by default {}

  • ax_res_kwgs (dict, optional) â Axis keyword arguments, by default {}

  • data_label (str or None, optional) â Data label for plotting multiple traces

  • fit_label (str or None, optional) â Fit label for plotting multiple traces

Returns

  • fig (Figure) â The figure object.

  • ax (Axes) â The axes object.

class tweezepy.smmcalibration.PSD(trace, fsample, bins=3, **kwargs)Â¶

A class for computing and fitting the power spectral density using maximum likelihood estimation.

Parameters

  • trace (array) â Bead positions in nm.

  • fsample (float) â Sampling frequency in Hz

  • bins (int, optional) â Number of bins, by default 3

Example

>>> from tweezepy import downsampled_trace
>>> trace = downsampled_trace() # Simulate sample data
>>> psd = PSD(trace,fsample = 100) # Compute PSD using Welch's method
>>> psd.mlefit() # Perform MLE fit
>>> print(psd.results)
mlefit(fitfunc='lansdorpPSD', cutoffs=[- inf, inf], tracking_error=False, guess=None, gamma=None, kappa=None, epsilon=None, kT=4.1, viscosity=8.94e-10, radius=530.0, pedantic=True, scale_covar=False, **kwargs)Â¶

Estimate parameters and uncertainties via maximum likelihood estimation.

Parameters

  • fitfunc (str or function, optional) â String or user defined function, by default âlansdorpPSDâ

  • tracking_error (bool, optional) â Incorporate tracking errors, by default False

  • guess (list, optional) â Initial parameter guesses, by default None

  • gamma (float, optional) â Fixed value for gamma parameter, by default None

  • kappa (float, optional) â Fixed value for kappa parameter, by default None

  • epsilon (float, optional) â Fixed value for epsilon parameter, by default None

  • pedantic (bool, optional) â Ignore unhelpful warning messages, by default True

  • kT (float, optional) â Thermal energy used in functions and initial parameter guesses, by default 4.1

  • viscosity (float, optional) â Dynamic viscosity for initial parameter guesses in pN s/nm^2, by default 8.94e-10

  • radius (float, optional) â Bead radius for inital parameter guesses, by default 530.

plot(fig=None, fig_kwgs={}, ax_fit_kwgs={}, ax_res_kwgs={}, data_label=None, fit_label=None, **kwargs)Â¶

Utility function for plotting

Parameters

  • fig (Figure, optional) â Matplotlibe Figure object, by default None

  • fig_kwgs (dict, optional) â Figure keyword arguments, by default {}

  • ax_fit_kwgs (dict, optional) â Axis keyword arguments, by default {}

  • ax_res_kwgs (dict, optional) â Axis keyword arguments, by default {}

  • label (str or None, optional) â Data label for plotting multiple traces

Returns

  • fig (Figure) â The figure object.

  • ax (Axes) â The axes object.

The AV and PSD classes use the base class calibration.

class tweezepy.smmcalibration.calibration(trace, fsample)Â¶

Base class for PSD and AV calibration.

Parameters

  • trace (array) â 1-D array of bead positions in nm

  • fsample (float) â Sampling frequency in Hz

traceÂ¶

1-D array of bead positions in nm

Type

array

fsampleÂ¶

Sampling frequency in Hz

Type

float

make_guess(kT=4.1, viscosity=8.94e-10, radius=530)Â¶

Estimate gamma based on Stokes drag and kappa based on equipartition theorem.

Parameters

  • trace (np.array) â Bead positions in nm

  • kT (float, optional) â Thermal energy in pN nm, by default 4.1

  • viscosity (float, optional) â Dynamic viscosity of solution in pN s/nm^2, by default 8.94e-10

  • radius (float, optional) â Bead radius in nm, by default 530

Returns

guess â gamma and kappa guesses

Return type

list

plot(fig=None, fig_kwgs={}, ax_fit_kwgs={}, ax_res_kwgs={}, data_label=None, fit_label=None, data_color=None, fit_color='k')Â¶

Utility function for plotting

Parameters

  • fig (Figure, optional) â Matplotlibe Figure object, by default None

  • fig_kwgs (dict, optional) â Figure keyword arguments, by default {}

  • ax_fit_kwgs (dict, optional) â Axis keyword arguments, by default {}

  • ax_res_kwgs (dict, optional) â Axis keyword arguments, by default {}

  • data_label (str, optional) â Legend label for data.

  • fit_label (str, optional) â Legend label for fit line.

Returns

fig, ax â Figure and axes objects.
